Description: The date the CVE was inserted.
List of keywords used to tag each event.
URL identifying a package collection (determines the meaning of packageName).
The default status for versions that are not otherwise listed in the versions list.
A list of the affected components, features, modules, APIs, commands, utilities, programs, or functionalities.
Name or identifier of the affected software package as used in the package collection.
List of specific platforms if the vulnerability is only relevant in the context of these platforms.
A list of the affected source code files.
Name of the affected source code file, function, method, subroutine, or procedure.
The URL of the source code repository, for informational purposes and/or to resolve git hash version ranges.
Name of the organization, project, community, or user that created or maintains this product or hosted service.
The version at which a status change occurs.
The new status in the range starting at the given version.
The non-inclusive upper limit of the range.
The inclusive upper limit of the range.
The vulnerability status for the version or range of versions.
The single version being described, or the version at the start of the range.
The version numbering system used for specifying the range.
Supporting media data for the description such as markdown, diagrams, etc.

Windows products that can apply this patch.
The UUID for the organization to which the CVE ID was originally assigned.
The short name for the organization to which the CVE ID was originally assigned.
The CVE identifier that this record pertains to.
The date/time the CVE Record was first published in the CVE List.
The date/time the CVE ID was rejected.

The system of record causes this to start at 1, and increment by 1 each time this CVE Record changes.
